DOC.brief_summary: In 3-phase study , follow initial small-scale ( phase 1 ) feasibility trial , aim phase 2 project investigate whether community-based , 12-month intervention overweight obese preschool child 2-6 year age family effective reduce participant ' degree overweight ( BMI z-score ) improving quality life . In final phase ( phase 3 ) , participate child randomize either receive multidisciplinary lifestyle intervention first 6 month ( treatment arm ) , 6 month later ( control wait list arm ) , order generate robust effectiveness data . Participants receive additional free 6-month YMCA membership participate study .
DOC.brief_title: FOR HEALTH : A Family-oriented Healthy Eating , Activity Lifestyle Intervention Overweight Preschool Children
DOC.criteria: Children age 26 study entry primary overweight obesity , BMI = > 85th percentile age sex 2010 WHO Growth Charts Canada Family meet Readiness change criterion , contemplation high stage , accord Prochaskas Transtheoretical Model . At least one parent/caregiver commit attend program session child Parent/caregiver agree complete study questionnaire require time point Chronic medical condition potentially impact program participation associate potentially increase risk participation ( e.g . type 1 diabetes mellitus , heart , gastrointestinal , kidney disease , uncontrolled asthma , physical , developmental psychological disability could limit extent study participation Regular use medication could limit extent study participation Other concurrent recently ( last 12 month ) receive obesity treatment Inability read , speak , and/or verbally understand English Living outside great London , Ontario , area
